question: Q1 If you were to consider your life in general these days, how happy or unhappy would you say you are, on the whole? (Please tick one box only.)
Q2 In general, how much confidence do you have in the health care system in [country]? (Please tick one box only.)
Q3 Is it fair or unfair that people with higher incomes can afford better health care than people with lower incomes? (Please tick one box only.)

answer.-1: ZA: Not available for Afrikaans and Zulu questionaire versions

ZA.-1: Not available for Afrikaans and Zulu questionaire versions

question: Q4 How much do you agree or disagree with the following statements? (Please tick one box on each line.) Q4a People use health care services more than necessary.
Q4 How much do you agree or disagree with the following statements? (Please tick one box on each line.) Q4b The government should provide only limited health care services.
Q4 How much do you agree or disagree with the following statements? (Please tick one box on each line.) Q4c In general, the health care system in [country] is inefficient.
Q5 How willing would you be to pay higher taxes to improve the level of health care for all people in [country]? (Please tick one box only.)

Q6 How much do you agree or disagree with the following statements? (Please tick one box on each line.) Q6a People should have access to publicly funded health care even if they do not hold citizenship of [country].

Q6 How much do you agree or disagree with the following statements? (Please tick one box on each line.) Q6b People should have access to publicly funded health care even if they behave in ways that damage their health.
Q7 In [country], do you think it is easier or harder to get access to health care … (Please tick one box on each line.) Q7a ... for rich people than for poor people?
Q7 In [country], do you think it is easier or harder to get access to health care … (Please tick one box on each line.) Q7b ... for old people than for young people?
Q7 In [country], do you think it is easier or harder to get access to health care … (Please tick one box on each line.) Q7c ... for women than for men?

Q7 In [country], do you think it is easier or harder to get access to health care … (Please tick one box on each line.) Q7d ... for citizens of [country] than for people who do not hold [country's] citizenship?

Q8 Severe health problems may have many causes. How much do you agree or disagree with the following statements? (Please tick one box on each line.) Q8a People suffer from severe health problems because they behaved in ways that damaged their health.

Q8 Severe health problems may have many causes. How much do you agree or disagree with the following statements? (Please tick one box on each line.) Q8b People suffer from severe health problems because of the environment they are exposed to at work or where they live.

Q8 Severe health problems may have many causes. How much do you agree or disagree with the following statements? (Please tick one box on each line.) Q8c People suffer from severe health problems because of their genes.

Q8 Severe health problems may have many causes. How much do you agree or disagree with the following statements? (Please tick one box on each line.) Q8d People suffer from severe health problems because they are poor.

Q9 To what extent do you agree or disagree with the following statement: [Alternative/traditional/folk] medicine provides better solutions for health problems than [mainstream/Western conventional] medicine? (Please tick one box only.)
Q10 How much do you agree or disagree with the following statements about doctors in general in [country]? (Please tick one box on each line.) Q10a All things considered, doctors can be trusted.

Q10 How much do you agree or disagree with the following statements about doctors in general in [country]? (Please tick one box on each line.) Q10b The medical skills of doctors are not as good as they should be.

Q10 How much do you agree or disagree with the following statements about doctors in general in [country]? (Please tick one box on each line.) Q10c Doctors care more about their earnings than about their patients.

Q11 During the past 12 months, how often, if at all, did you use the internet on any device (such as computers, tablets and smartphones) to look for health or medical information for yourself or someone else? (Please tick one box only.) (IF CODE 1-6,-8: GO TO Q12) (IF CODE -4: GO TO Q14)

question: OPTIONAL QUESTION Q31_OPT Considering your work activity before the Covid-19 pandemic and at present, which of the following statements best describes your employment situation… (Please tick one box only.)

answer.1: I did not have a job before the pandemic and I do not have a job now

answer.3: I lost my job due to the pandemic and now have a new job
answer.4: I lost my job due to the pandemic and could not find a new job
